item.description:
Zero Down in 2009!

Do you remember the "Nothing Down" books from the 80's? How about the revised "Nothing Down for the 90's" books? And then.... what about for today's market? Local investor and Turning the Key attendee Sean Carpenter has been doing deals in a new and creative way using government subsidies. That's not a typo!

Sean is using government funds to cover his down payments and rehab costs on a properties. The funds are there for the taking, all part of the government Bailout Billions and are set aside waiting for investors like you. The only thing is, you need to know where to go to get these funds, how to apply for them, how to use them and how to stay on the right side of the law.

Of note, Sean will be covering:
• His 5 favorite HUD programs
• Why he loves Section 8
• The Low Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC)
• Expiring Use Projects
• Working with State Agency programs
• Working with the new Foreclosure Bill
• How he uses these programs and more for nothing down deals

At our February 5th Turning the Key meeting presented by ForeclosuresMass.com, Sean will be joining us for a pitch-free pure education event and sharing his tips for getting
the funding and doing nothing down deals with government grants. Seating is Limited; Pre-registration is HIGHLY recommended

When: February 5th, 6:30 pm

Where: Holiday Inn, Dedham, Mass

Cost: $45 at the Door (no exceptions)•$15 for Pre-Registrations •$10 for Pre-Registered Members and FREE for TTK Pass Holders and TTK Auto Pay Subscribers

Check out a great interview that Jeremy had with Sean at: www.foreclosuresmass.com/blog!

To Register or for more information: Call 617.275.4800 or visit www.ForeclosuresMass.com

group.name: Real Estate Networking/Education Meeting in Boston

item.name: ForeclosuresMass' Turning the Key Networking/Education Event February Meetup
